intro: Cyrtandra × keanaeensis, commonly known as the Kona cyrtandra, is a hybrid plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as rainforests, where it thrives in the humid climate. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a smooth texture, while its stems are often covered in fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
